title: Guns N' Roses - The Ultimate Best Of..(2-CD)..2015 320ak
description:
Guns n' Roses aren't necessarily a band that's well suited to hits compilations, since their albums capture the raw, messy vitality of their music.
 
Since the So called Greatest hits album was horribly weak and had just a taste of the band. It actually made the band out to be one dimmentional it was a disservice .But Axel was not playing nice by leaving everything hanging for SO long they should have catapulted into the 21st century as a Monster band instead of sitting on jackstands with Axel saying each year that its coming dont worry its comming, Ill put the new wheels on and we cruise.

 So we've been left to manufacture our own. 
It is hard to give a rating for it because its way past its due date we get a Knock off G'nR "Band" fronted by Axel who still had not quite got over whatever hung em up so long ago that No one knows why it happened .
Did he think that the window would stay open until the next decade or 2?
So this and other compilations have appeared and im sure there will be some more And probably at least 2 more from me somewhere down the line. 
Anyway this record, because it's not something new for occasional listeners and diehard fans (except for maybe Sympathy For the Devil, which was never released on any GN'R record). Nevertheless, it's Guns N Roses, multi-platinum hard rockers from L.A., and they deserve a top mark, And this does cover it pretty good. I would say its what the Greatest Hits Record should have looked like and thats enough from analogkid6103

Im not a reviewer Im an outlaw uploader. I keep talkin and somebody might think I would rather be doing honest work, LOL..... yeah right

Now dont get lost now this is the tracklist to Geffins GnR Greatest Hits Package released uh...um ... well fuk it dont matter it was very long ago before Napster.
 Cassettes were still alive.

01. Welcome To The Jungle 
02. Sweet Child O' Mine  
03. Patience 
04. Paradice City 
05. Knockin' On Heaven's Door 
06. Civil War: 
07. You Could Be Mine  
08. Don't Cry (original) 
09. November Rain 
10. Live And Let Die  
11. Yesterdays 
12. Ain't It Fun 
13. Since I Don't Have You  

14. Sympathy For The Devil? 
Seriously dude? this was not a great hit at least for GnR
it was just a filler/tease from Axel to placate the fans while they still were.Its worthy only cause there was nothing else.

They are all decent tracks but to release this and say its their Greatest hits. 
Weak. 
That list should be at least twice the size.

So Here is the Tracklist for THIS Greatest hits album and let justice be done.
And who really knows maybe they will have a reunion before it looks like..... 

The Travelling Guns N' Wilburys. UGH

Now Here Is a Tracklist that works for me.....

Its your choice but I will call it a 2-CD Enjoy and do me like Axel did us tell me you will seed and not. And come around  and tell me again and not ...seed if you keep. thx
